name: Association of Cyprus Banks
membership:
European Banking Federation (EBF)

goal: The ACB was established in 1969 and is the formal voice of the local banking sector. The ACB is a non-profit organization that represents and promotes the interests of its member banks concerning banking business and practices. The ACB puts forward its membersâ€™ views and positions when local legislative and governmental policies are determined. Common positions are formulated on several banking and financial issues, especially in compliance with EU regulations and guidelines. Currently, the ACB, has 12 members.
interests: Competition, Consumer Affairs, Economic and Financial Affairs, Financial Stability, Financial Services and Capital Markets Union , Internal Market, Taxation
euInitiatives: Capital markets union, Banking supervision, MIFID, Payment services, AML, Retail and consumer issues (mortgage credit, Payment Accounts Directive, Financial Education, Digital Banking), UCITS, Corporate Social Responsibility.
